message.content: Yes, the authors mention the type of resources used - they performed experiments on a MacBook Pro 2019, with a 2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 processor and 64 GB 2667 MHz DDR4 memory. They also specify that the experiments were run in parallel using multicore CPUs and without the use of GPUs for a fair comparison.

Yes, the authors mention the type of resources used for the experiments in a footnote. They state that the experiments were performed on a MacBook Pro 2019, with a 2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 CPU and 64 GB 2667 MHz DDR4 RAM. They also mention that all experiments on synthetic datasets were computed in parallel with multicore CPUs, without GPU for fair comparison.

Yes, the authors include the type of resources used for the experiments. They mention that the experiments were performed on a MacBook Pro 2019 with a 2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 processor and 64 GB 2667 MHz DDR4 RAM. They also mention that all experiments were computed in parallel with multicore CPUs without using GPU for a fair comparison.
